poem:
### Morning Headlines

In the cold dawn light,  
two old chess masters  
exchange nods across the board—  
a game begun anew  
while distant pawns shiver,  
uncertain of the moves  
made in shadow,  
the echo of abrupt laughter  
rolling like fog  
across a field  
where kings and queens  
are castles in the air.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Putin congratulates Trump on election win and says Russia ready for dialogue | First Thing Good morning. Vladimir Putin has congratulated Donald Trump on his election victory and said Moscow was ready for dialogue, in a development that will deeply concern Kyiv and dial up unease across Europe. Speaking publicly about Trump’s win for the first time on Thursday at a discussion forum in Sochi, the Russian president also heaped praise on the way Trump". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
